body:
Hi Brian,

 

Thank you for the information about the procedure. 

 

Thank you & Regards,

Zalak Shah

Systems Analyst

CACR | Indiana University

2719 E. 10th Street, Suite 231 | Bloomington, IN 47408 

 <mailto:zsshah@iu.edu> zsshah@iu.edu

 

 

From: Brian Lin [mailto:notifications@github.com] 
Sent: Thursday, March 16, 2017 3:08 PM
To: opensciencegrid/security <security@noreply.github.com>
Cc: Shah, Zalak Sunilkumar <zsshah@iu.edu>; Author <author@noreply.github.com>
Subject: Re: [opensciencegrid/security] List of broken links on the page: https://opensciencegrid.github.io/security/ (#1)

 

Zalak, I think Brian was asking that you fix the broken links in your own fork and submit the PR so that it can be merged (and eventually built). For example, the first broken link in your table appears on this page <https://opensciencegrid.github.io/security/IncidentDiscoveryReporting/>  and can be fixed via the following procedure:

1.	Click the Edit on Github <https://github.com/opensciencegrid/security/edit/master/docs/IncidentDiscoveryReporting.md>  link in the top right
2.	Fix the offending link target in the markdown window
3.	Preview your changes
4.	Once satisfied with your changes, add a short description for your change
5.	Click the second radio button for creating a new branch and starting a pull request, then submit the proposed changes

Binary files like PDFs don't do well in version control systems.

—
You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <https://github.com/opensciencegrid/security/pull/1#issuecomment-287160768> , or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AUOT1l8bjbwqbiu-V4O4aGM6s6AXjtTvks5rmYiWgaJpZM4MfuR2> .
